translation: Why do I talk about tolerance?
transcript: 为什么来讲这个宽容呢？

translation: Because I’m not a tolerant man.
transcript: 因为我不是一个很宽容的人。

translation: Why are we not tolerant?
transcript: 为什么我不是一个很宽容的人呢？

translation: Because we are often suppressed.
transcript: 因为我们经常被打压。

translation: As you all know, criminal defense lawyers in China need to face prosecutors, the police, and the court all day, as well as judges who are also on their side.
transcript: 因为大家知道，中国刑事辩护律师整天面对的就是公安、检察，还有法院、裁判也是他们那一边的，所以你想……

translation: As the western saying goes, “When judges and prosecutors stand together, God can be the only defender”.
transcript: 这西方有句话嘛，“当法官和检察官站在一起，就是只能上帝作为辩护人”。

translation: Less than a month ago, I handled a case involving a criminal organization in Guizhou.
transcript: 我大概一个月不到之前就在贵州，办一个黑社会的案子。

translation: There were 57 defendants, all standing in the assembly hall of a cinema, queuing in lines with more than 100 bailiffs watching.
transcript: 啊57个被告人，站在电影院的大礼堂，下面这个被告排队排得都很好，100多个法警。

translation: There were bailiffs in the court and usually without orders from the presiding judge, bailiffs are not allowed to move around.
transcript: 那么中间有法警，按理来说开庭，没有审判长指挥法警不能随便走的。

translation: Yet a bailiff approached me and took away my timer that was suspected to be a video recorder and examined it.
transcript: 那法警过来过来就把我前面，计时的一个钟给拿走了，他认为是摄像设备，就拿去检查了。

translation: Later, he came back again and took something else.
transcript: 过了一会儿，又来拿我一东西。

translation: What was it?
transcript: 什么东西呢？

translation: A highlighter maker, claiming it was a wiretap device.
transcript: 一支荧光笔，他又拿走了，认为是窃听器材。

translation: So I raised an objection to the presiding judge saying, "He is violating my property rights, how could he just take away my stuff?"
transcript: 诶我向审判长抗议，我说：“这不侵犯我财产权呢，怎么能随便拿东西呢？”

translation: But the presiding judge answered, “It doesn’t matter. We can talk about it later.”
transcript: 诶审判长说：“这没事，等会再说。”

translation: I replied, “No, it does. Maybe later he is going to take away my files, my computer and he might as well take me away.”
transcript: 我说：“这不行啊，接下来他又把我案卷拿走了，电脑拿走了，最后人抓走了！”

translation: Finally, I told him, “If you don’t adjourn, I will have to quit. Because my physical safety and property rights are threatened.”
transcript: 最后我说：“你再不休庭，我要退庭啦，因为我要人身财产安全得不到保。”

translation: So he adjourned.
transcript: 好，他休庭了。

translation: For this trial, actually the defendants were not working for a criminal organization.
transcript: 当时在审这个黑社会的时候呢，其实真的不是黑社会！

translation: So when the defendants claimed that the police had tortured them for a confession, the police issued a written statement stating that they didn’t torture them.
transcript: 所以当这些人说警察刑讯逼供我，警察出一个书面证明说：“我没有刑讯逼供！”

translation: The defendants shouted, "You’re lying!"
transcript: 被告人说：“你们说谎！”

translation: One of them said, "The judge tried to pursuade me to change my lawyer".
transcript: 最后他说：“法官跟我做工作，要把律师换掉。”

translation: Then the judge said, "I didn’t do that."
transcript: 法官说：“我们没有做工作。”

translation: The defendant then claimed that the judge was also lying.
transcript: 他说：“法官说谎！”

translation: In the end, the older defendants said, “You guys are messing around. I am an old man now, so I can’t really do anything after staying in prison for a few years, but they are young. They are gangsters who are in their 20s. When they get out of prison, there is still a lot that they can do.”
transcript: 到后来，老年的被告人都说，“你们这样瞎整，我是老了坐几年牢出来不怎么样，他们还年轻，因为你说他黑社会确实都是二20几岁的人啊，他们还是要会出来的。”

translation: Basically, he implied that the young defendants would seek revenge.
transcript: 言下之意是出来他们要报复你们的。

translation: After knowing the situation, my last defense was, “No matter how many years the sentence will be, don’t seek revenge after getting out. When you lead a happy life, it will be the biggest revenge because justice will be served. But if you seek revenge, all my efforts now will be in vain because the law is not respected, and justice will not be served”.
transcript: 所以看了这个情况，我的最后辩护词说，我说：“你们出来不管判你们多少年，不要以牙还牙，以血还血，你们日子过好了，是他们对他们最好的报复，正义自然会来到！如果你们再去报复又是犯罪，我们来帮你们辩护就是白辩了，因为法律得不到尊重，正义得不到实现。”

translation: People are often suppressed, but still the value of tolerance should be promoted to some extent.
transcript: 所以这就是，我们认为我，虽然经常被打压，但是在某些程度方面，还是要宣宣扬这个宽容的价值。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么会这么说呢？

translation: Because our society is full of hatred, and tolerance is rarely seen.
transcript: 因为我们这个社会啊，充满戾气，很不宽容。

translation: Let’s take ordinary people for an example.
transcript: 我们先从民间说起吧。

translation: I saw on the news today that a man got a fake money from an ATM, but the bank didn’t take accountability.
transcript: 今天我看到的新闻：一个人取款机里取出一张伪钞到银行，银行不认。

translation: So the man bought some firecrackers and blew up the ATM.
transcript: 他就买一个爆竹，把这个ATM机给炸了。

translation: See how intolerable people are.
transcript: 看民间是多么不宽容。

translation: A couple of days ago, I received a case.
transcript: 前两天我们代理的一个案子是在雪天。

translation: It was on a snowy day, a man got drunk and naked so the traffic patrol officers cuffed him on their platform.
transcript: 下雪天因为酒喝多了，酒喝多了之后呢，把自己衣服扒光了，交巡警呢就把他拷在交巡警平台上。

translation: The man was sentenced to one year in prison with the crime of provocation.
transcript: 这个人始作俑者这个裸男，后来被判刑一年寻衅滋事罪。

translation: That is just the beginning.
transcript: 这这是故事刚刚开始。

translation: Then a man passed by, just like I’m walking now, and saw the naked man cuffed on the platform.
transcript: 有个人路过，像我这样走过，咦，这大雪天怎么有个裸男拷在这里。

translation: He thought it was funny.
transcript: 好玩！

translation: So he borrowed a camera from his friend, took a picture with the comment, "The job of traffic patrol officers is to protect people. Why did they cuff a naked man there? He’s been cuffed for hours. The man is strong!"
transcript: 到朋友那儿去借相机，拍了拍了一张说：“交巡警平台本来是保护老百姓的，怎么能把一个裸男拷在那里呢？都已经拷了好几个小时了，这人身体真不错！”

translation: He uploaded it to QQ.
transcript: 就发在QQ，就是QQ的空间上。

translation: The guy was sent to a laogai camp for two years.
transcript: 这人被劳教两年。

translation: A buddy saw the man’s post online and said, "Is it real? A naked man on a snowy day?"
transcript: 又有哥们儿，“你看你这个帖子上的那个照片，那个裸男雪天照片是真的吗？”

translation: "Yeah, it’s true."
transcript: “啊是真的！”

translation: "Okay. I will forward the news."
transcript: “那我就转载咯。”

translation: He got two years in laogai camp for forwarding the news.
transcript: 转载过去，也劳教两年。

translation: How intolerant it is!
transcript: 你说这有多么不宽容？

translation: Just like in ancient China, if an author wrote something that was considered offensive, his property would be confiscated.
transcript: 这就跟我们以前“清风不识字，何故乱翻书”就要被被抄家。

translation: It’s the same now, just to a different extent.
transcript: 只是程度不同而已！

translation: Why would this happen?
transcript: 为什么会这样？

translation: Last month I was in Shanghai and I got a phone call.
transcript: 在上海，一个月前，我接到一个电话。

translation: The man said he was calling from a psychiatric hospital.
transcript: 他说：“诶我是精神卫生院打来的。”

translation: “Are you a doctor?” I asked.
transcript: 我说：“你是医生吗？”

translation: “No. I’m a patient.” He answered.
transcript: “不是，我是病人。”

translation: “How did you get my number?” I asked.
transcript: 诶我说：“你怎么知道我电话？”

translation: “I got it from someone else.” He replied.
transcript: 他说：“别人给我的。”

translation: “I’m not mentally ill. I was sent here by the local police station.”
transcript: 他说：“我不是精神病，我是被派出所送进来的。”

translation: “I have a younger brother. I’m not mentally ill. I was put here because I had a fight with the police.”
transcript: 他说：“我还有弟弟呀，我还有我有个弟弟，我真的不是精神病，我因为跟他们吵架被送进来的。”

translation: I didn’t believe him.
transcript: 我就不相信。

translation: So I answered, “Okay. Give me your name and the name of the mental health facility.”
transcript: 但是我说：“可以，你把名字报给我，把具体精神病卫生院的这个名字告报给我。”

translation: So I asked my assistant to check it out and I posted on Weibo, "seeking verification" and I mentioned "Shanghai publication".
transcript: 我就叫我的助理去查，然后我又发了微博，我说“求证”，@ “上海发布”。

translation: Later on, I found out that this man was kept there for eight years for the wrong reason!
transcript: 后来查出来，这个人关确实关错了八年哪！

translation: Since the local police station sent him there, the staff thought he had no parents nor siblings.
transcript: 因为派出所他送进去的，认为认为他是父母全无，兄弟姐妹都没有了。

translation: The neighborhood committee and Civil Affairs Bureau became his guardian.
transcript: 所以说居委会是是他的监护人，民政局是他的监护人。

translation: At first, the Civil Affairs Bureau was reluctant to let us see his files, claiming that they were his guardians.
transcript: 开始民政局还不让我们看，不让我们见，说：“我们是他的监护人。”

translation: I told them, “He has a younger brother. You can go check it out. If it’s true, his brother is the guardian”.
transcript: 我说：“他还有弟弟啊，你们去查一查，如果有弟弟他直系亲属才是监护人啊。”

translation: It turned out that he had a younger brother and a younger sister.
transcript: 最后查出来，不但有个弟弟，还有个妹妹。

translation: Proving he was falsely detained!
transcript: 是不是搞错啦！

translation: This happened in a city like Shanghai, even though it’s the most developed and civilized place in China.
transcript: 那你想一想这也是发达地区啊，中国最文明的地方，我体验下来啊，上海是中国最文明的地方，那还有这种情况出现。

translation: The situation is the same between the government and the people.
transcript: 政府、民间都这个样子。

translation: Why are we not tolerant?
transcript: 那你说我们为什么会这么不宽容呢？

translation: Is it because of culture?
transcript: 是文化原因吗？

translation: Do Chinese people carry a gene of intolerance?
transcript: 难道我们的文化基因当中就有这个不宽容的基因吗？

translation: I don’t think so.
transcript: 我认为不是的。

translation: There is always both tolerance and intolerance in every culture.
transcript: 每一种文化啊，它都有宽容和不宽容的这种东西。

translation: Many of us think that western culture is quite tolerant and it respects people.
transcript: 那我们再来看看，那大家看看现在西方觉得很宽容啊，很尊重啊。

translation: A classmate of mine went to the U.S. with me and praised the U.S. as a nation with manners.
transcript: 我一个同学跟着我一起到美国觉得诶他说：“啧美国真是礼仪之邦啊。”

translation: I said, “Don’t jump to conclusions so early. Stay for a bit longer, then tell me what you think”.
transcript: 我说：“你先别这么说，你再再多待几天。”

translation: Did you how many people were burnt to death in western countries because of religious persecution?
transcript: 西方以前大家知道，宗教裁判所被烧死的人有多少？

translation: Let’s talk about Catholicism.
transcript: 你说这天主教。

translation: Okay.
transcript: 那好吧。

translation: How many people were burned to death in Geneva Galvin, the protestant?
transcript: 新教，加尔文在日内瓦烧死多少人？

translation: Not to mention anti-Semitic people, witches being burnt to death, and the crusades marching through the east.
transcript: 更不用说反犹反犹太人，烧死女巫、十字军东征。

translation: Can you call them tolerant?
transcript: 你说它还能宽容吗？

translation: Was there tolerance in their culture?
transcript: 文化当中一定很宽容吗？

translation: Not exactly.
transcript: 不见得吧。

translation: Western tolerance started since their religious revolution because Protestants began to say, “I don’t need Catholic formalities because God speaks for people, so each man can stand in front of God with a Bible”.
transcript: 它的宽容应该是从宗教改革开始的，因为新教开始说：“我不需要你这个天主教的那一系列东西，上帝代言人，每个人通过《圣经》都可以站在上帝面前。”

translation: From then on, western culture started to become more tolerant because people’s religious beliefs became diversified.
transcript: 这个时候开始，才有一些宽容，增加一些宽容，因为大家可以信仰多元了。

translation: The Protestants in the U.K. had a tough time, so they went to a new continent and founded a new country called, the United States.
transcript: 当然你去看英国最后，英国的清教徒还是因为在英国待不长，跑到美国搞了一个新大陆，搞了一个新的国家。

translation: Now you can see that in various cultures, there are different cultural components.
transcript: 所以你去看，多种文化，它里面不同成分都有。

translation: In the U.K., among other island countries, I believe that there are many integrated factors that have combined to create a democratic and a constitutional system.
transcript: 在英国，在这个岛国当中，我认为有很多综合因素结合在一起，产生了一个民主制度，产生了一个宪政制度。

translation: It has defined the scope of the country and society, as well as the separation of church and state, which may have a great impact on tolerance.
transcript: 它界定了国家和社会的范畴，可能规定了政教分离，这恐怕对宽容有很大的影响。

translation: Some of the things we advocate for now have been promoted by the United Nations.
transcript: 我说我们现在提倡的一些东西，在联合国也已经得到推广。

translation: The core principle is to respect people’s spiritual pursuits and that there’s a limit to that.
transcript: 它的核心就是你要尊重人的精神之至，而且这种精神之至。

translation: In other words, the differences in spiritual pursuits should be communicated and treated in a peaceful manner.
transcript: 它是有一定界限，就是双方之间的不同，应该用和平的方式来解决。

translation: So let’s go back to the topic.
transcript: 那我们再来讲。

translation: Why should I talk about tolerance?
transcript: 为什么现在要讲宽容？

translation: Because nowadays, China has entered a pluralistic era.
transcript: 是因为现在中国，正是一个多元混合的时代。

translation: There are conflicts between cultures, between people and between interests.
transcript: 文化冲突、人的冲突还有利益冲突。

translation: When I talk about these backgrounds, I believe that we need to get rid of the conflicts, and alleviate the intolerance between the government and society.
transcript: 到这里讲到这些背景，确实现在要推除这种冲突，也要缓解社会和政府之间的这种不宽容。

translation: How can we do it?
transcript: 那么怎么样才能做到宽容呢？

translation: First of all, the strong should be tolerant.
transcript: 首先，强者你要宽容。

translation: If you are one of the majority, you need to be tolerant because this is the only way minorities will feel a sense of security.
transcript: 你是多数的，你要宽容，因为只有这样，少数的人才会有一些安全感。

translation: If the strong are intolerant, they will eventually go to the extremes in the end.
transcript: 那么如果你强者不宽容，最后会走向极端的。

translation: Secondly, in an environment where the strong are tolerant, the government should pass laws to protect the interests of the weak because their identities are interchangeable.
transcript: 第二，在这种强者的宽容当中，你需要政府立法，来保护一些弱者的利益，就像我们说的强、弱，它之间会互移的。

translation: That is to say, I’m an individual and so are you.
transcript: 所以这就是，你有的时候他也是个人你也是个人。

translation: Which is I prefer the Buddhist mantra that, “Everyone is the same”.
transcript: 所以这我就比较推崇佛教的众生平等。

translation: There are still much intolerance deeply rooted in western culture, including colonization and racial segregation.
transcript: 我觉得这就是，为什么在西方文化当中它还是有很多根深蒂固的这种不宽容，包括殖民主义、种族隔离。

translation: It wasn’t that long ago these problems were solved.
transcript: 没解决多长时间啊。

translation: Black people didn’t have the right to vote before the civil rights movement in the 1960s.
transcript: 你想六十年代的民权运动，六零年之前黑人没多少投票权的。

translation: George Bush Jr.’s decision to attack Iraq is a prime example that the strong are intolerant.
transcript: 包括小布什，他去打伊拉克，也是一种强者的不宽容。

translation: He said, “Iraq has weapons of mass destruction”.
transcript: 他说：“伊拉克有杀伤性武器。”

translation: Did Iraq have them?
transcript: 有没有？

translation: No.
transcript: 没有。

translation: Did Iraq have nuclear bombs?
transcript: 原子弹有没有？

translation: No.
transcript: 没有。

translation: So the strong should make concessions.
transcript: 所以这种强者的迁移。

translation: If they don’t, they are going to pay a high price for it.
transcript: 如果你不迁移，你代价很大。

translation: The U.S. paid a lot for the war in Iraq.
transcript: 美国为这场强战争付出的代价是非常大的。

translation: Many soldiers sacrificed their lives, not to mention all of the money that was spent.
transcript: 不用说钱，多少珍贵的士兵的生命。

translation: We’re running out of time, so let's us look back at Lu Xun.
transcript: 回过头来因为时间原因，讲到鲁迅。

translation: Why could Lu Xun be tolerant?
transcript: 鲁迅为什么不宽容？

translation: Because of the time he was in and the same reason applies for Hu Shi.
transcript: 因为他所身处的时代，但是同时代还有胡适。

translation: We all know Hu Shi was a liberal, and he always called for tolerance.
transcript: 大家知道胡适是一个自由主义者，他一直催一直是在推广。

translation: He believed that tolerance is more important than freedom.
transcript: 容忍比自由更主要。

translation: The core of liberalism is democracy, freedom, tolerance over opposition and gradual reform.
transcript: 自由主义的核心：民主、自由、容忍反对派、渐进改革。

translation: Those were the main ideologies Hu Shi promoted.
transcript: 这是胡适的推广的核心。

translation: In the end, I want to tell you this.
transcript: 所以到最后，我跟大家说。

translation: Please be kind to others because that is the only way others will be kind to you in return.
transcript: 你要善待他人，因为有一天你就会成为他人。

translation: Drinking together is so much better than fighting.
transcript: 约架不如约酒！

translation: Thank you very much!
transcript: 谢谢大家！
